meanings.definition: Extracted milk from (a cow or other animal)
meanings.sent1: The farmer performed the milking of the cows every morning.
meanings.sent2: The dairy worker milked the cow gently to collect fresh milk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to milk the dog for treats, but failed.
meanings.sent4: She milked the situation for all it was worth, gaining maximum benefit.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cow being milked stayed in his mind as a peaceful scene.

meanings.definition: Exploited or defrauded (someone) by taking money or possessions from them
meanings.sent1: The scam artist milked unsuspecting victims of their life savings.
meanings.sent2: He milked his parents for money to buy unnecessary gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The greedy character in the story tried to milk everyone for their riches.
meanings.sent4: She milked the opportunity to get freebies from the event organizers.
meanings.sent5: The con artist milked the wealthy businessman for all he had, leaving him broke.

meanings.definition: Squeezed or manipulated (something) to extract a benefit or advantage
meanings.sent1: The coach milked every last drop of effort from his players during the game.
meanings.sent2: She milked the situation to her advantage by playing innocent.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor milked the design to create multiple useful products.
meanings.sent4: He milked the information from the document to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The politician milked the public's sympathy to gain more votes in the election.
